alert.note: Alert for Northern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 7:44PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Rosebud County through 830 PM MDT... At 741 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms over northern Rosebud county, with the strongest storm 25 miles northeast of Forsyth. The storms were moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail, wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Rosebud County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
